content:
```python
import json
import re
from datetime import datetime

def normalize_profile(profile):
    """Normalizes a professional profile according to the specified guidelines."""

    normalization_notes = []
    normalized_profile = profile.copy()

    # 1. Company Names
    def normalize_company_name(company_name):
        if not company_name:
            return company_name

        company_name = " ".join(company_name.split())  # Remove duplicate spaces
        company_name = re.sub(r'\.+', '.', company_name)  # Standardize periods

        # Apply standard capitalization (proper case, preserve acronyms)
        words = company_name.split()
        normalized_words = []
        for word in words:
            if word.isupper() and len(word) > 1:  # Preserve acronyms
                normalized_words.append(word)
            else:
                normalized_words.append(word.capitalize())
        company_name = " ".join(normalized_words)

        # Standardize common variations
        company_name = company_name.replace("Inc.", "Inc")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Incorporated", "Inc")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Llc", "LLC")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Ltd.", "Ltd")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Limited", "Ltd")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Corp.", "Corp")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Corporation", "Corp")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Self Employed", "Self-Employed")
        company_name = company_name.replace("Fleishmanhillard", "Fleishman-Hillard")


        return company_name

    # 2. Job Titles
    def normalize_job_title(job_title):
        if not job_title:
            return job_title

        job_title = job_title.replace("Sr.", "Senior")
        job_title = job_title.replace("Sr", "Senior")
        job_title = job_title.replace("Mgr", "Manager")
        job_title = job_title.replace("Proj.", "Project")
        job_title = job_title.replace("Assoc.", "Associate")
        job_title = job_title.replace("Asst.", "Assistant")

        # Standardize capitalization (first letter of each word)
        words = job_title.split()
        normalized_words = [word.capitalize() for word in words]
        job_title = " ".join(normalized_words)

        return job_title

    # 3. Skills
    def normalize_skill(skill):
        if not skill:
            return skill

        skill = skill.strip()
        skill = skill.replace("Salesforce.com", "Salesforce")
        skill = skill.replace("Digital Mktg", "Digital Marketing")
        skill = skill.replace("Class Management", "Classroom Management")
        return skill

    # 4. Locations
    def normalize_location(location):
        if not location:
            return location

        location = location.replace("NYC, New York", "New York, New York, United States")
        location = location.replace("Dallas, TX", "Dallas, Texas, United States")
        location = location.replace("Austin, Texas Area", "Austin, Texas, United States")
        return location

    # 5. Dates
    def normalize_date(date_str):
        if not date_str:
            return date_str

        date_str = date_str.replace("Jan", "January")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Feb", "February")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Mar", "March")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Apr", "April")
        date_str = date_str.replace("May", "May")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Jun", "June")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Jul", "July")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Aug", "August")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Sep", "September")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Oct", "October")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Nov", "November")
        date_str = date_str.replace("Dec", "December")

        if date_str.lower() == "present":
            return "Present"

        try:
            # Try parsing as "Month YYYY"
            date_object = datetime.strptime(date_str, "%B %Y")
            return date_object.strftime("%Y-%m")
        except ValueError:
            pass

        try:
            # Try parsing as "MM/YYYY"
            date_object = datetime.strptime(date_str, "%m/%Y")
            return date_object.strftime("%Y-%m")
        except ValueError:
            pass

        return date_str  # Return original if parsing fails

    # Normalize top-level fields
    normalized_profile["title"] = normalize_job_title(normalized_profile.get("title", ""))
    normalized_profile["location"] = normalize_location(normalized_profile.get("location", ""))

    # Normalize key skills
    if "key_skills" in normalized_profile and isinstance(normalized_profile["key_skills"], list):
        normalized_profile["key_skills"] = [normalize_skill(skill) for skill in normalized_profile["key_skills"]]

    # Normalize experience
    if "experience" in normalized_profile and isinstance(normalized_profile["experience"], list):
        for exp in normalized_profile["experience"]:
            if "company" in exp:
                original_company = exp["company"]
                exp["company"] = normalize_company_name(exp["company"])
                if original_company != exp["company"]:
                    normalization_notes.append(f"Company name normalized from '{original_company}' to '{exp['company']}'")
            if "title" in exp:
                exp["title"] = normalize_job_title(exp["title"])
            if "location" in exp:
                exp["location"] = normalize_location(exp["location"])
            if "duration" in exp:
                if "start_date" in exp["duration"]:
                    original_start_date = exp["duration"]["start_date"]
                    exp["duration"]["start_date"] = normalize_date(exp["duration"]["start_date"])
                    if original_start_date != exp["duration"]["start_date"]:
                        normalization_notes.append(f"Start date normalized from '{original_start_date}' to '{exp['duration']['start_date']}'")
                if "end_date" in exp["duration"]:
                    original_end_date = exp["duration"]["end_date"]
                    exp["duration"]["end_date"] = normalize_date(exp["duration"]["end_date"])
                    if original_end_date != exp["duration"]["end_date"]:
                        normalization_notes.append(f"End date normalized from '{original_end_date}' to '{exp['duration']['end_date']}'")

    # Add normalization notes if any changes were made
    if normalization_notes:
        normalized_profile["normalization_notes"] = "; ".join(normalization_notes)

    return normalized_profile
```
